dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A 360 million dollar deal for a boxer? That seems, uh, incredibly inflated even for someone like Canelo Alvarez.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A three hundred sixty million dollar deal for a boxer? That seems, uh, incredibly inflated even for someone like Canelo Alvarez.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million, an average of $33 million per fight, according to his promoter Golden Boy Promotions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not just the base deal, right? His promoter Golden Boy says it's a minimum of 32 million per fight on DAZN. And that's before the Golovkin rematch money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not just the base deal, right? His promoter Golden Boy says it's a minimum of thirty two million per fight on D A Z N. And that's before the Golovkin rematch money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million, an average of $33 million per fight, according to his promoter Golden Boy Promotions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, sure, but 120 million in a single year? That's more than most athletes earn in a decade.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, sure, but one hundred twenty million in a single year? That's more than most athletes earn in a decade.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the two DAZN fights, plus roughly $50 million for his razor-thin win over Gennady Golovkin last month and several million dollars from endorsements, Alvarez should bank at least $120 million over the 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, think about it—he just got 50 million from the GGG win, plus endorsements. And if he fights GGG again in May, that number's gonna skyrocket.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, think about it-he just got fifty million from the G G G win, plus endorsements. And if he fights G G G again in May, that number's gonna skyrocket.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the two DAZN fights, plus roughly $50 million for his razor-thin win over Gennady Golovkin last month and several million dollars from endorsements, Alvarez should bank at least $120 million over the 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But moving from HBO to this streaming service, DAZN... is that a risk? HBO was basically the home of boxing for decades.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But moving from H B O to this streaming service, D A Z N... is that a risk? H B O was basically the home of boxing for decades.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The premium cable network had set the standard for televising the sport for more than four decades, and its pay-per-view arm featured many of boxing's biggest stars, including Sugar Ray Leonard, Evander Holyfield, Oscar De La Hoya, Manny Pacquiao, Floyd Mayweather and dozens more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Actually, HBO's out of the boxing game now. This is a huge opportunity for DAZN—they're making a serious play with this and the Matchroom deal too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actually, H B O's out of the boxing game now. This is a huge opportunity for D A Z N-they're making a serious play with this and the Matchroom deal too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But HBO announced last month that it would end its coverage of boxing at the end of 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, comparing him to global football stars like Messi? Messi pulled in 111 million this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, comparing him to global football stars like Messi? Messi pulled in one hundred eleven million this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He ranked second on this year's list at $111 million, behind only Mayweather.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and Alvarez could top that next year. This deal puts him right in that highest-paid athlete conversation, no question.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and Alvarez could top that next year. This deal puts him right in that highest-paid athlete conversation, no question.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Mexican boxer has a strong chance to rank as the worlds highest-paid athlete next year in Forbes annual look at the top stars in sports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I just find it hard to believe a boxer can out-earn Messi or Neymar consistently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I just find it hard to believe a boxer can out-earn Messi or Neymar consistently.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But look at the per-fight numbers—it's on par with Mayweather's Showtime deal, and we saw how that paid off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But look at the per-fight numbers-it's on par with Mayweather's Showtime deal, and we saw how that paid off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only comparable deal in boxing history was the six-fight pactMayweather signed with Showtime in 2013. It guaranteed around $200 million, on par with Alvarez's per-fight average.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Fair point. I guess if anyone can pull it off, it's Canelo, especially with Golovkin as a potential opponent again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fair point. I guess if anyone can pull it off, it's Canelo, especially with Golovkin as a potential opponent again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And with HBO bowing out, DAZN's timing is pretty perfect to capture a star like him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And with H B O bowing out, D A Z N's timing is pretty perfect to capture a star like him.
